title: I GOT BANNED FOR 2 WEEKS AROUND AUG-SEP  AND IM CHALL
body:
Hello Newto here I play on the OCE server and I'm just wondering if I could get a hold of a riot employee as I got banned around aug-sep.

I am currently rank challenger and never been banned before I came back to playing league for the first time in about 6-8 months and got banned for toxicity, from 1-2 games when I came back.

I am not a toxic player and I have always followed the league of legends summoner code and I apologize for my mistake considering I was going through a rough trot at the time but I don't think I deserve to lose my challenger rewards because of one lazy mistake.

Ps. I have been playing league since late season 2 - season 3 and have never had any offences and someone please reply to me asap

- Newto

Hey Newto,

I know it must suck to be hit with a ban, particularly so close to the end of the season, from one or two mistakes. You need to remember, however, that toxicity just makes the experience worse for most/all the people involved, regardless of whether it was intentional. As someone who has never been punished, and has come to value a lack of toxicity in-game, I know I'd be devastated if I got punished (even a 5 game chat restriction) for one or two mistakes (even though I haven't played much recently).

In regards to the ranked rewards, the information on the [Ranked Rewards Eligibility](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/115011781068) page states the following:
> There are a few ways to miss out on this season’s rewards:
* Players with bans or chat restrictions active when the season ends are ineligible for this year’s rewards.
* Players issued a ban of seven days or more from 8/22/2017 are ineligible for this year’s rewards.
* Players banned for boosting during the 2017 season remain ineligible for rewards.
* Players who experience fraud-related or erroneous bans will still be eligible.

So it seems that, as long as the ban in question was issues *before* the 22nd of August, you will still be eligible for ranked rewards.

With that said, you can feel free to post the chat logs relating to the ban for review by the community (and the Volunteers and *maybe* one or two Rioters). You should have received an email containing the logs, if not you can always submit a ticket to [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us) requesting the logs, and we could even see if there's a Rioter available to post the logs for you (with your permission, of course).

As a final note, if you do believe the punishment to be made in error (even if it's a matter that you feel the punishment was merely too severe) you can submit a ticket to [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us) to appeal the ban, who will pass it along to the Player Behaviour team who will then review the case. Remember to submit a different ticket for each issue.

If you have any further questions or concerns, feel free to speak up.

This is what is ruining the game. I have been 2 week banned on my smurfs within 1 day for literally 1-2 games i get tilted on by people shit talking me. This is a adult world and while you can "mute" being heavily penalised when the previous 6.5 years no one gave a fuck is ridiculous. Not to mention your support team when you send in a ticket are fucking useless and show little care. I lost a diamond account that was played since season 1 and owned 90% of skins, just thrown a way by a few games i got tilted in.. where as last season you could literally tell everyone to go fuck themselves on a daily basis and get a mere chat restriction. I get you dont want to people to be toxic, but shit happens. Dropping a ban hammer within 1-2 days of games is going to kill this server and your game so fast. I mean, no one i know plays this game anymore.

A punishment system that gets reviewed thoroughly by a employee i can justify, but a system that has 2 triggers, bad language and reports based on players in a game that generally report people for EVERY loss and abuse your slightest mistakes is complete bullshit. And dont once tell me you review peoples reports, it takes 30 hours for a simple ticket to get a response, and thats generally a fucking automated one. Just writing this post makes me mad as fuck at how stupid you have made this game, i have no idea why i even bother with this shit anymore, its not even fun.. and majority of streamers dont even play this shit. NOT TO MENTION there are countless videos of pro players/streamers being abusive and because of their fame NOTHING happens.

Yes you are expected to know what is acceptable in any one game, and know if there are any people who are going to report for no real reason.

Hell when i got banned it was because of manual review, because i'd never been banned by the bot because it was never enough of the whiny shits that reported me.

What we need is Riot to either take a hard stance on behaviour, or stop taking such a hard stance on behaviour, but again, this isn't what they want to do, they want to look like they are doing something to toxicity without actually putting in the effort to actually do anything against the people who are actually toxic.

I'm going to be honest, I agree with the sentiment. From the perspective of a player, it certainly seems like Riot's punishment systems could use some improvements, particularly to efficiency. I understand it often seems as though the truly toxic players are able to evade any actual punishment, while the more benign players take the brunt of it (keep in mind, this is an observation about how the community sees the effectiveness of the systems in-place). I've seen a lot of toxic players come to the boards to dispute their bans, which has given me a smidgen of trust in the system, but at the same time I also see a lot of players upset with the (supposed) lack of action from the system, which does give me some doubt.

One of the main areas I think the systems could use improvement is feedback to the players. The Instant Feedback System notifications are a great start on that, however they have been almost untouched since they were first implemented, and only cover a select group of punishment types (typically chat and connection related, from what I understand). While there are resources for players to get an idea whether another player has been punished, they don't tell the whole story, which can make players unsure whether the player i question was banned or just stopped playing for a time, and gives no indication to lower tier punishments.

My biggest issue is consistency when it comes to the banning system.

Fact is before i got banned for 2 weeks, i had CONSISTENTLY acted the same way and was never banned.

Which leaves me of one of two options.

1. My ban was unjustified, as my behaviour was alright.
2. The system sucks, and it took a manual review for me to be banned for bad behaviour.

And for me, both of these options seem to apply on my end, sure some times i went a bit over the top and deserved the ban, other times, the ban is just shit, and at the time i got the ban, it was all in 1 not anything like a 2.

And you know what i got into a game as i was typing this, GP support who was deliberately stealing CS, and i'd be the bad guy for leaving the game, and this isn't an uncommon scenario.

EDIT: And as another point now that i'm out of game, the inconsistency shows even with the people who come in here complaining, not many of the complaint's come from NEW players, meaning the bot hasn't noticed them for in cases YEARS (there was someone who had been playing since Season 4 according to OP.GG not long ago, and the rioter in that thread said all punishments had been within 12 months) which honestly isn't good enough.

You need to have a stance on these punishments, or else when people get banned, they have no fucking clue why.

Had i received a chat ban _**ever**_ before i got a 2 week ban, i'd probably not shit on the system so much, but having just got a straight 2 week ban, i REFUSE to believe that the system works.

so someone in chall makes this kind of post and gets voted up and supported by multiple people but when someone in bronze/silver makes this kind of post they get down voted and most comments are negative.

I've seen a lot of threads regarding issues similar to this one, where players are certain (or, in some cases, act certain) that they've been wrongly punished. Most of the time you'll get players who will do one (or more) of several things that reflect negatively on them, including (but not limited to):

* Presenting their post(s) using behaviours that would and/or did get them punished in-game (such as harassment, offensive language, slurs etc.)
* Presenting chat logs that show such behaviours (as mentioned in the previous point)
* Intentionally omitting parts of chat logs to remove such behaviours, then having a Rioter call them out and provide the omitted logs.

In those cases, it's easy to look at the situation in retrospect and understand why they've received several downvotes. Newto has exhibited none of those behaviours, and quite frankly I find it easier to trust people who present their points in a constructive manner, without intentionally omitting information that is relevant when required/asked (like chat logs, or parts of them).

Considering that, and that Newto appears to have support from several other players who are effectively speaking as "character witnesses", it makes sense that this particular thread would be receiving some upvotes, rather than a bunch of downvotes.
